title: cd2030 User Guide
text:
1 Introduction
Welcome to the cd2030 User Guide! This guide is designed to help you navigate the features and functionality of the cd2030 Shiny app. Whether you are a beginner or an advanced user, this guide provides step-by-step instructions to load data, analyze results, and generate reports effectively.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See @knuth84 for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: cd2030 User Guide
text:
1.1 About the App
The cd2030 Shiny App is a comprehensive tool for analyzing, visualizing, and reporting health-related data. Designed for researchers, policymakers, and program managers, the app integrates datasets such as UN estimates, WUENIC estimates, survey data, and health facility data to generate insights and customizable reports.

title: cd2030 User Guide
text:
1.2 Key Features


Data Integration: Easily upload and manage datasets from multiple sources.

Dynamic Visualizations: Generate charts, tables, and summaries to explore trends and patterns.

Custom Annotations: Add notes to enhance documentation and support collaboration.

Report Generation: Create tailored reports in various formats to suit your needs.

title: cd2030 User Guide
text:
1.3 Prerequisites
To use the app, you’ll need:

A working installation of R (version 3.6 or higher) and RStudio.
Required R packages (listed in the installation section).
Access to datasets such as:

UN estimates
WUENIC estimates
Country-specific survey data


Health facility datasets for analysis.

title: cd2030 User Guide
text:
1.4 How to Use This Guide
This guide is structured to take you from setup to advanced usage. You can navigate through the sidebar to access sections such as:


Getting Started: Instructions for installing and launching the app.

App Features: Learn how to load data, generate visualizations, and create reports.

FAQs: Troubleshoot common issues and access additional support.

For detailed help on specific pages within the app, use the Help button provided in the interface.

title: cd2030 User Guide
text:
1.5 Acknowledgments
This app and guide were developed by the African Population and Health Research Center (APHRC).

title: 2  Getting Started
text:
2.1 Prerequisites
Before using the app, ensure you have the following:

title: 2  Getting Started
text:
R (version 3.6 or higher): Download it from CRAN.

RStudio: Download it from RStudio.

Data Access: Ensure you have access to datasets such as UN estimates,WUENIC estimates, and survey data.

title: 2  Getting Started
text:
2.2 Installing the App
The cd2030 Shiny App is hosted on GitHub. To install it:

Open RStudio.
Run the following commands to install the app:


if (!require('pak')) install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("damurka/cd2030")

This will download and install the app on your system, along with all required packages.

title: 2  Getting Started
text:
2.3 Launching the App
Once installed, launch the app using the following commands:

library(cd2030)
dashboard()

The app will open in your default web browser, ready for use.




Figure 1: Launching the cd2030 Shiny App.

title: 2  Getting Started
text:
2.4 Next Steps
With the app installed and running, proceed to the App Features section to explore its functionality and workflows in detail.

title: 3  App Features
text:
3.1 Title Bar
The Title Bar provides essential controls and displays the current context of the app. The contents of the Title Bar, such as “Set Cache Directory/SaveCache” and “Download Report,” are only displayed after data has been loaded into the app.

title: 3  App Features
text:
3.1.1 Features of the Title Bar


Country Selection:

Displays the name of the selected country (e.g., “Senegal - Countdown Analysis”).




Set Cache Directory/Save Cache:

Button to specify a directory for saving intermediate results and progress.




Download Report:

Button to download the final report or page-specific results.

title: 3  App Features
text:
3.2 Sidebar
The Sidebar provides navigation for the app, with steps arranged sequentially to guide the user through the workflow. Each section represents a critical component of the analysis.

3.2.1 Features of the Sidebar


Introduction:

Provides a brief overview of the app’s purpose and functionality.




Load Data:

Allows users to upload datasets (e.g., UN estimates, WUENIC estimates).




Quality Checks:

Steps for checking data consistency, completeness, and outliers.
Subsections include:

Reporting Rate
Outlier Detection
Consistency Check
Data Completeness
Calculate Ratios
Overall Score






Analysis Setup:

Options for loading data used in data analysis include UN Estimates, WUENIC estimates, and survey data.




National and Subnational Analysis:

Tools for analysis of equity and coverage at national and subnational levels. This section will only work after completing the Analysis Setup section.

title: 3  App Features
text:
3.3 Body Content
The central workspace where the main analysis and visualization tasks are performed.

3.3.1 Features of the Body Content


Page Title:

Displays the current module or analysis step (e.g., “Reporting Rate”).




Action Buttons:


Generate Report: Downloads a report for the current page.

Add Notes: Allows users to annotate specific elements or results.

Get Help: Provides context-sensitive guidance for the current page.
